text.School of Politics, Security, and Intl A: School of Politics, Security, and Intl Affairs

p.In an increasingly shrinking, interdepen: In an increasingly shrinking, interdependent world, an understanding of diplomacy and diplomatic processes is critical for work in global business, international organizations and government. Students who complete this minor will gain experience in diplomatic history, concepts, theories, methods, protocol and practice.

li.A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all: A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all courses used to satisfy the minor.
li.At least 15 hours used in the minor must: At least 15 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the participating departments.
li.Most courses for this minor will have pr: Most courses for this minor will have prerequisites completed as a part of a student's GEP requirement, as general electives, or a student can enroll into courses with consent of instructor.

courseSection0.text:
In an increasingly shrinking, interdependent world, an understanding of diplomacy and diplomatic processes is critical for work in global business, international organizations and government. Students who complete this minor will gain experience in diplomatic history, concepts, theories, methods, protocol and practice.
Minor Requirements
A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all courses used to satisfy the minor.
At least 15 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the participating departments.
Prerequisite Courses
Most courses for this minor will have prerequisites completed as a part of a student's GEP requirement, as general electives, or a student can enroll into courses with consent of instructor.

courseSection0.text1: AMH4513 - US Foreign Relations: Close of World War II to the Present (3)

courseSection1.text0: Course substitutions are subject to prior approval by the minor advisor.

li.Internship, independent study, and subst: Internship, independent study, and substitute courses/new courses are allowed at the minor advisor's discretion limited to a maximum of 3 credit hours.

courseSection0.text:
Other Requirements

Internship, independent study, and substitute courses/new courses are allowed at the minor advisor's discretion limited to a maximum of 3 credit hours.
